Title:
The taxonomic re-examination of Cryptomeria gall disease
causing fungi
Keywords:
Botryosphaeria ; Cryptomeria japonica ; Guignardia ;
Phylogeny ; Morphology
Abstract:
In this study, to re-examine the taxonomic position of the
Cryptomeria gall disease causing fungi it was researched morphological
characteristics and molecular phylogenetic analysis. As the result of
observed the morphological characteristic, this fungus was identified
with a species of the Botryosphaeria genus. However, as the result of
molecular phylogenetic analysis, this fungus was included in the clade
of the Guignardia genus, therefor it was differed a result of the
identification by the morphological characteristics observation and the
molecules phylogenetic analysis. It is necessary to change the
classification standard of both genera to establish the taxonomic
position of this fungus, however, recently it was supported by the
molecular phylogenetic analysis including the both genera and its
related genera ware clearly divided into the Botryosphaeria genus and
the Guignardia genus. Therefore, it was suggested that this fungus was
more likely to a new species of the Guignardia genus.
